meanings.definition: Give strength or firmness to (a muscle or part of the body)
meanings.sent1: After exercising regularly, his muscles tonified and became stronger.
meanings.sent2: The physical therapist recommended specific exercises to tonify the weakened muscles.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's secret power was the ability to tonify his muscles instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her determination tonified her resolve like a steel rod.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mountain climber tonifying his muscles at sunrise was inspiring.

meanings.sent1: The herbal tea tonified her spirits and gave her energy for the day.
meanings.sent2: Adding fresh herbs to the dish tonified the flavors and made it more delicious.
meanings.sent3: The music tonified the atmosphere of the party, making everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: His words tonified her confidence like a powerful elixir.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise tonified the colors of the sky, painting it in vibrant hues.
